intro: Pachystoma, commonly known as the desert broom, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the warmer months. Pachystoma is adapted to survive in harsh environments with minimal water, featuring deep root systems and thick, waxy leaves to reduce water loss. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various desert wildlife.
